Context:
Program Name: Supply Chain Management
Code: B429
Credential: Ontario College Graduate Certificate
Duration: 2 semesters
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $6,642.00
International Tuition: $18,253.00
Location: St. James Campus
Program Overview: A one-year program that teaches students how to design and manage supply chains in various industries. Prepares students for positions in global sourcing and procurement management, transportation and distribution management, production management, business planning, supply chain analysis, and logistics management.
Courses are delivered with an emphasis on applied and experiential learning, covering topics such as supply chain optimization, risk management, and sustainable sourcing.
Industries: transportation, pharmaceutical, oil and gas, retail
Skills gained: technical expertise, innovative thinking, relationship-building.

Context:
The Supply Chain Management program at the college equips graduates with skills to guide decision-making based on strategic objectives, stakeholder expectations, and supply chain functions. Graduates can enter various positions in global sourcing and procurement management, transportation and distribution management, production management, business planning, supply chain analysis, and logistics management. Common job titles include: supply chain planning coordinator, operations/logistics coordinator, operations systems analyst, inventory analyst, business demand coordinator, and sales analyst.

To graduate, students must complete 13 mandatory courses over two semesters. Semester 1 includes the following courses with no prerequisites: MGMT 4092 - Supply Chain Strategy, MGMT 4093 - Supply Chain Sustainability, MGMT 4094 - Sourcing and Purchasing, MGMT 4095 - Risk Management, MGMT 4096 - Technology Integration and Analysis, MARK 4005 - Applied Business Communication, and MGMT 4097 - Career Planning.

Semester 2 courses and their prerequisites are: MGMT 4098 - Performance Management and Logistics (MGMT 4092), MGMT 4099 - Transportation and Logistics (MGMT 4092), MGMT 4100 - Warehousing (MGMT 4092), MGMT 4101 - Supply Chain Management Design and Optimization (MGMT 4092 & MGMT 4093), MGMT 4102 - Inventory and Forecasting (MGMT 4096), and MGMT 4103 - Experiential Learning.

Program learning outcomes include the ability to examine the connections between strategic objectives, stakeholder expectations, and supply chain design, functions, processes, and roles to guide decision-making, problem-solving, and coordination of tasks.

Context: The text mentions that the role of a supply chain management professional includes determining the value added and financial implications of supply chain decisions, ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory obligations, using risk mitigation tools, contributing to strategic planning and scheduling, coordinating efficient handling and movement of goods, services, materials and related information, identifying and managing continuous improvements, using technologies to enhance performance, monitoring trends and emerging technologies, and establishing strategic relationships with stakeholders. The text also provides the estimated tuition fees for domestic and international students for programs starting in Fall 2023 and Fall 2024, with a note that all fees are subject to change without notice and do not include the cost of books. There is no explicit mention of the name or specific program offered by the college in the text.

- Admission Requirements: Ontario College diploma (2-year), Ontario College advanced diploma (3-year), bachelor's degree or equivalent
- English Language Proficiency: Required for international students without English proficiency test results and those considered based on work experience
